column2: HAWAII DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed and move to the left.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column10: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 2. While driving you come upon a sign which says, “reduced speed 35 MPH”. You as a driver should know:
column4: that you have plenty of time to slow down before the speed zone.
column6: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at this sign.
column8: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at the next “speed limit” sign.
column10: that the sign is put there to harass “good” drivers.

column2: 3. Your BAC depends on:
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 4. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 5. When you drive into the street from any driveway you:
column4: can disregard pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
column6: must drive slowly so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can get out of your way.
column8: must honk the horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can allow you room.
column10: must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.

column2: 6. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column10: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 7. This road sign indicates that:
column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 8. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column8: green; white

column2: 9. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column8: Service signs

column2: 10. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column6: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column10: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 11. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the right lane.

column2: 12. To drive defensively, you must:
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column8: Merging traffic from the right

column2: 14. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 15. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column8: Experienced drivers.

column2: 16. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column8: Lap and shoulder belt only

column2: 17. A yellow “X” over the traffic lane means:
column4: You must keep driving in that lane, proceed with caution.
column6: You may drive in that lane at reduced speed.
column8: The lane is for right turns only.
column10: Your lane signal is going to change to red. You must move out of that lane of traffic.

column2: 18. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column8: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column10: they already are within the intersection.

column2: 19. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 20. If one of your tires blows out, you should:
column4: apply your brakes gently and steer smoothly where you want to go.
column6: pump your brakes and steer where you want to go.
column8: apply your brakes immediately.
column10: hold the steering wheel tightly, slowly take your foot off the gas pedal and steer smoothly where you want to go.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column8: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 22. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column8: whoever is slower

column2: 23. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: call the fire department immediately.

column2: 24. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 25. You may pass another vehicle:
column4: when there is a solid yellow line on your side.
column6: on a curve or a hill.
column8: on the shoulder of the highway.

column2: 26. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column8: drive much faster

column2: 27. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 28. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column8: an advance warning sign.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 30. Safety belts:
column4: should be worn at all times when driving or riding in a vehicle.
column6: need to be worn only if riding in the front seat.
column8: should be worn loosely.
column10: should not be worn when driving at slower speeds.
